div.l: Why haddist þow nat put hym in the lath
Alheyll Aleyn be God thow is a fonne
These sely Clerkis hath fast I ronne
Toward the fenne both Aleyn ⁊and Iohn
And when the Miller saw that they wer͗e goon
Halff a busshell of hir͗e mele he hath take
And bad his wyff go knede it in a Cake
He seid I trow the Clerkis were a ferd
Ȝit can a Millere make a clerkis berd
For al ther͗e arte ȝit let hem go ther͗e wey
Lo wher they go yee let hem go pley
They gete hem nat so liȝtly be my crown̄
These sely Clerkis rennyn vp ⁊and down̄
What kepe kepe Iust Iust ware the rere
Go quykly now ⁊and I shall kepe here
But shortly tyl it was verry nyȝte
They cowd nat in al the nyȝte
The Capell cache it ran a wey so fast
Tyll in a dike they cauȝt hym atte last
Wery ⁊and weet as beest is in the Reyn
Comyth sely Iohn ⁊and with hym Aleyn
Allas quod Iohn the day that I was born
Now are wee dryven to hething ⁊and to scorn
Our͗e corn is stole men woll vs folis call
Both the warden and our͗e felawis all
And namely the Millere welawey
Thus pleynyth he as he goith by the wey
Toward the Mill and beyard in his hond
The Millere by the feir they fonde
For it was nyȝte ferther myȝt they nauȝt
For the love of God they hym be souȝt
Of herburh and ese for hir peny
The Millere answerd yf ther͗e be eny
Such as it is yee shull have your part
Myne house is streyt but yee have lernyd arte
